name: whuppins
text:
It's "tattie", as in, "tough tittie".

...it's tough.

Please find something else to do

I was wrong

text: I think the guest strip of Phillipe getting beaten has the most lamed comment from asherdan.

name: nlaw
text: So "tattie" is equal to "tough tittie", then what is equal to "soft tittie(s)"?

name: tekende
text: "seft tatties"

name: johnnyrocker
text: sift tutties

name: ih8jonmayr
text: tig bitties

name: ravindra108
text: boobies!

name: i_love_kate
text: I'm pretty sure "tattie" in this context is a colloquial word for potato. Thus, tough potatoes. I'd guess that it's a phrase that entered American vernacular through Irish immigants, but the R words been thrown around here too much as it is.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: You should know that, i_love_kate. There are some Irish folk songs featuring tatties. Could be pronounced like taties, tho, dunno. Cause taties sounds like a word for titties.

name: soticoto
text: Boil 'em. Mash 'em. Stick 'em in a stew.

name: agentstinky
text: Daaaaaaaaamn I have my account set to hide comments with 90 or more lames, and this is the only one I've seen blocked so far.

name: liquidcruelty
text: Ugh dude do you even realize how rare/difficult it is for a punchline(ish) to include a racial slur and somehow still be clever and non-shock-humor?

name: slow_learner
text: I finally created an account just to read asherdan's lamed comments.

name: asherdan
text: Dang. I hope that worked out for you.

name: scifigrl47
text: Having done the same, no, it's been a bit of a letdown.  The responses are funnier without the actual source of their ire.

name: lolsworth
text: This is the worst comment. Typed on the ugliest keyboard.

name: saint
text: well...doesn't it?

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by waddie, Crowpaw, nutmeg)

name: catachresis
text: To qualify: he was a friend at the time. I don't want to disagree with The Specials. They are right.

name: wehavemagnums
text: "...it's time for that friendship to end"

name: zeal
text: I was afraid to pronounce Niger in front of my mom when I was Phillipe's age because I thought the country's name was a slur.

name: softerworld
text: To have any knowledge (however confused)about African rivers is pretty impressive for a 5 year old. I guess I am trying to say: well done, 5 year old Zeal.

name: severide
text:
Geography nerd here. Niger is a country as well as a river. I wouldn't have remembered that it was a river if not for your comment. But I definitely remember that it's a country.

Yeah. I don't exactly know what I'm doing.

name: invidious
text: Etymology trivia: niger (pronounced NEE-gur, close to by not quite the slur term) is the Latin word for "black."

name: invidious
text:
Though many today pronounce it "NY-jer" to avoid an uncomfortable verbal slip-up.

(tune in next year for the third post in this series)

name: mawk
text:
short interlude in which mawk wonders why virtually every original post in this string has at least one lame to it. bland trolling, or another well-intentioned soul who thinks it's politically incorrect to acknowledge the existence of racial slurs, or race in general?

Occam's Razor, I know, but I've met so many of the latter lately that for me it's worth it to wonder.

name: mawk
text:
short interlude in which mawk wonders why virtually every original post in this string has at least one lame to it. bland trolling, or another well-intentioned soul who thinks it's politically incorrect to acknowledge the existence of racial slurs, or race in general?

Occam's Razor, I know, but I've met so many of the latter lately that for me it's worth it to wonder.

name: dissembly
text:
Julius Caeser would not have recognised his name on most documentaries.

In Latin, it is pronounced something like Yulius Ky-ser (hence the German "Kaiser" for a powerful ruler).

True fact.

name: redmange
text: Are you saying people that find the word nigger funny do not deserve friends?  I have plenty of friends.  I am hurt by your slander.  You do not have to be a racist to think that word sounds funny.  ((But it sure does help!))

name: tbtabby
text: That's nothing. Ever hear of Niger Innis?

name: charchar
text: The sad this is that I have.

name: hyetal
text:
I don't know what year 8 means, but I had a friend that did this in 5th grade (approximate age: 11) and the whole class erupted in laughter.

I didn't, though. Because I didn't get it.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Year 8 is like aged 13.

5th grade is 11? Seriously? Man I COMPLETELY don't understand the American school system. And I went out with an American guy for a year and a half.

name: laserblade
text: Kindergarten is 5-6, first grade is 6-7, fifth grade is 10-11.  Usually.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Damn. In the UK (or at least England) you have playgroup or nursery, at about 3-4, which is sort of to get you to start socializing with large groups of little kids, then you start Primary school with Reception which is the first year of actual education as opposed to just fingerpainting or whatever, at age 4-5, then Year 1, age 5-6, Year 2 age 6-7, Year 3 age 7-8, Year 4 age 8-9, Year 5 age 9-10 and then Year 6 age 10-11.

Then you start secondary school with Year 7 and continue the cycle up to Year 11 when you take your GCSEs at age 16, then you can leave school if you want to (although I heard they're changing it?), or you can stay on for Sixth Form up to Year 13 and do A levels, or you can go to another school's Sixth Form (like I did), or you can go to a college and do A levels there, or you can go to a college and do a vocational course. Then you may or may not decide to go to university, usually at age 18 depending on whether you repeated any years or took a gap year or whatever.

And now you know lots of stuff about the British education system. Any questions?

name: i_love_kate
text: *raises hand*

name: tonyhighwind
text: What is the british distinction between college and university?  Because it doesn't really exist here.

name: heccibiggs
text: College is "further education" and university is "higher education". You can go to college at like age 16 but you can't go to uni until you're 18. There's probably more important distinctions but I'm really hungover.

name: tonyhighwind
text: No need to find them, you have made it very clear.  Thank you!

name: dissembly
text:
I gave you a chubby for being hungover a year ago.

Not completely sure why it impressed me, but it did.

name: gigs
text:
It's okay.

We don't understand it either.

name: zefiel
text: As a Mexican who has tacos on airplane trips, I can't help but agree with this strip.

name: sargasm
text: If I were the Mexican President, I would have tacos all the time.  But that's only because tacos are extremely delicious.

name: centipede_damascus
text: He probably has a taco or a burrito. Maybe a taquito, if he is trying to watch his weight.

name: philosophe
text: I just realized that burrito means little donkey.

name: sittered
text: or little ass

name: drskradley
text:
I like my little ass with bean and cheese. Maybe some sour cream and guacamole, if I'm feeling cah-razy .

But one should not let their little ass get too crispy, nor too soft. A little ass should have a good texture, with soft, slightly spicy filling. Not too spicy a little ass, though.

Aaaaand I'm done.

name: zeal
text: I can sense retardo homing in on this thread. Terrible things are going to happen.

name: soticoto
text:
...... 2 years. No sign of him.
You got me though, if that counts. ^_^

name: tekende
text: EDWELL EDWELL EDWELL

name: shutup_shutup
text: I like mine with lettuce and tomato.

name: spinynorman
text: Holy shit.

text: The actual US president probably isn't completely confident on this matter either...

name: tonyhighwind
text: He is now!

name: drskradley
text: Your avatar is fantastic.

name: tbtabby
text: Considering the sort of things that come out of Mexico in the Acheworld universe, I wouldn't be surprised. It'd me one of the more sane Mexican exports.

name: zeal
text: Compared to an RV with a constant downpour inside a private jet with a dirt floor is pretty reasonable, yeah.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: How would one pronounce "Niggeria"? I think it would work best with the same stress pattern as "pizzeria".

name: hellofditties
text: ...Are you serious?  Are you seriously asking this?

name: fuckyoufriday
text: nope, it's an ill uuu sion!

name: heccibiggs
text:
I think that's what it's supposed to be pronounced like. It looks as though there's an accent over the second i.

I'm not quite sure what hellofditties is so outraged about.

name: foetus_punch
text: It's pronounced like Nye-geeria. Nye, as in Bill.

name: heccibiggs
text: No, we know how to pronounce Nigeria. We're talking about Ray's little Sunday school mishap, "Niggeria".

name: foetus_punch
text: I am a fool. I smash my guitar in shame.

name: zathyr
text: I accurately followed the conversation.  I leave my guitar intact.

name: laserblade
text: Yes, the accent on the i strongly implies that it's supposed to be pronounced like "taquería".

name: jonmw
text: Well, where do you think they got the name from?

name: wallabeechamp
text: I also pronounced Nigeria as "Niggeria." I had a double whammy because I also pronounced "Niger" as "Nigger." I didn't know the g's were soft!

name: rowboat
text:
Quote:
I didn't know the g's were soft!

Anyone who calls himself "wallabeechamp" should damn well know that g's ain't soft!

name: wallabeechamp
text: That is quite possibly the greatest comment of all time....

name: boheeka
text: Once upon a time, I believe it was right around first or second grade, our music teacher said the n-word during class. I'm not quite sure why. She was talking about... John Phillips Sousa? Apparently he wrote some music for... slaves? Maybe she was quoting from a book? I don't quite remember, but she definitely said that word. I'm not sure if I'd heard that word before but I knew there was something wrong with it and I was confused about the whole thing because the teacher was one of my favorites. I went home and I guess the issue wouldn't settle peacefully in my subconscious because later that Dad and I were reviewing for a spelling test and he asked me to spell some word and out of my mouth comes: "N... I... G... G... E... R.."

name: stonecrab
text: This is a kind of a thing that happened to each of us while we were growing up.  I'm definitely feelin' Ray here.

name: puguglypress
text: WHY DOESN'T NIGERIA JUST CHANGE ITS FUCKING NAME ALREADY JESUS

name: greenkoolayd
text: back in the day my mom, 3 younger brothers, and i were going out for dinner. she said us kids could pick where we went. everyone threw in their $0.02, except the 2nd youngest(he was 3 or 4). he said, "i want to get ken fuck y fried chicken!
